title: Science education site: Blue light and circadian rhythm

requirements.summary: Build a responsive, science-focused informational single-page website explaining blue light effects on circadian rhythm in clear English.
acceptanceCriteria: The site loads without errors and renders correctly on mobile and desktop screen sizes.
All user-facing text is in English and focuses on the science of blue light and circadian rhythm.

file_operations.description: Implement the main single-page layout with responsive structure, readable science-focused copy, and section anchors; compose shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Separator/Button) for consistent layout and callouts. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable section wrapper component to standardize spacing, max-width, headings, and responsive layout across all content sections; compose shadcn-ui primitives where helpful. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a reusable callout component for key definitions and takeaways (e.g., 'Key idea', 'Why it matters') using shadcn-ui Card styling for consistent presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the app bootstraps cleanly with the newly created App component and global styles import paths matching the project structure.
Confirm document metadata remains appropriate (language already set to English) and align title/description-related head elements with the science information site.

requirements.summary: Add six clearly labeled content sections covering definitions, circadian biology, mechanisms, evidence summary, practical strategies, and cautions/limitations with a visible disclaimer.
acceptanceCriteria: All six content areas are present as clearly labeled sections on the site.
The content includes at least one short explanation of the biological pathway linking blue light exposure to melatonin/circadian phase effects.
A limitations/disclaimer section is present and clearly visible.

file_operations.description: Add the six required sections with clear headings and anchor IDs: (1) What is blue light, (2) Circadian rhythm & melatonin, (3) Mechanisms (ipRGCs/melanopsin + alerting effects), (4) Evidence summary, (5) Practical mitigation strategies, (6) Cautions/limitations + visible disclaimer text; include at least one concise biological pathway explanation in the mechanisms section.
Centralize the English educational copy, section titles, and bullet lists so the page can render structured content consistently and avoid scattered hard-coded text.

Create a prominent, reusable disclaimer component (not medical advice; individual differences; brightness/duration/timing considerations) and render it in the limitations/cautions area; use shadcn-ui Alert (or similar) if available. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Display clear author credits attributing the site to both specified names exactly.
acceptanceCriteria: The rendered site visibly credits both "PushpakSaha" and "Md. Zawraiz Khan" (spelled exactly) in a consistent location (e.g., footer and/or About section).

file_operations.description: Implement a footer with a consistent credit line that includes both author names exactly as provided: "PushpakSaha" and "Md. Zawraiz Khan"; compose shadcn-ui typography/layout primitives if appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the footer into the page so the author credits are visible on all screen sizes and remain in a consistent location.

requirements.summary: Provide basic navigation to quickly reach each major section (single-page scroll-to navigation or small routes) without reload issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can access each major section from a top navigation element.
Navigation works without full page reload errors.

file_operations.description: Create a top navigation bar with links that scroll to each major section anchor on the single page; implement responsive behavior (e.g., condensed menu on small screens) by composing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Sheet/DropdownMenu if available). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small hook/utility that performs accessible, smooth scroll-to-section behavior (including focus/offset handling for fixed nav) without triggering full page reloads.
Wire TopNav into the layout and ensure all major sections have stable IDs that match navigation targets.

requirements.summary: Add a References section with a short, readable bibliography-style list of credible sources and avoid overly specific claims without context.
acceptanceCriteria: A "References" (or equivalent) section exists and contains multiple credible sources.
The site avoids presenting overly specific numerical claims without citation context.

file_operations.description: Add a clearly labeled References section with multiple credible sources (e.g., review articles and academic/medical institutions) in a readable bibliography style; keep wording high-level and avoid precise numerical claims without citation context.
Store the references list (titles, organizations/journals, and optional links) as structured data to render consistently and support future edits without changing layout code.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent science-education visual theme (typography, spacing, components) consistently, avoiding a generic blue/purple look.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent, intentional visual style across navigation, headings, body text, and callouts.
The primary theme is not a generic blue/purple gradient look.

file_operations.description: Define a cohesive global theme using CSS variables and Tailwind layers (typography, background, foreground, borders, callouts) with a non-blue/purple primary palette (e.g., warm neutrals + amber/green accents) and consistent spacing defaults.

Adjust theme tokens and typography defaults (via Tailwind + typography plugin) to match the chosen science-education look and ensure consistent headings/body/callouts across sections without relying on a blue/purple gradient aesthetic.

Apply consistent typography and layout classes (e.g., readable line length, section spacing, callout styles) to enforce the theme across nav, hero, sections, and footer; compose shadcn-ui components to match theme tokens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Include required static generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in relevant sections without using the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated and are displayed on the site.
No backend endpoints are used to fetch or proxy these images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero illustration asset at the specified path for use in the page hero section.
Add the generated infographic asset at the specified path for use in the mechanisms/biology section.
Add the generated icon set asset at the specified path for use in sources/strategies callouts or section headers.

Render the static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-blue-light.dim_1600x700.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/melatonin-pathway-infographic.dim_1400x900.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/blue-light-icons-set.dim_512x512.png in the hero/mechanisms/strategy areas with accessible alt text and responsive sizing; ensure images are loaded as static frontend assets (no backend usage).
